Text: Biocompatibility:  The term refers to the ability of a material to perform with an appropriate host response in a specific situation.

Text: Biocompatibility:  The ambiguity of the term reflects the ongoing development of insights into how biomaterials interact with the human body and eventually how those interactions determine the clinical success of a medical device (such as pacemaker, hip replacement or stent).
